page.title: 07REHABILITATION CENTRE
page.content: The centre was developed from{1961 on the site of an{1898}children's home and now covers{26.5}acres with a{17 foot fence.It now receives young men between{17}and{21}committed from Crown and Magistrate's courts in Cumbria, Northumbria, Durham, N,Yorks, Cleveland and Tyne and Wear.The centre can hold up to{133}inmates, and holds {92}at this point.Serving{3}weeks to four months under the new"Short Sharp Shock"treatment a newly introduced scheme of punishment for young offenders.Most have previous convictions but{10%}are sentenced on their first offence.60% for theft and {13%}for violence. Prisoners receive weekly wages of{60p}to{Â£1.20}for work in the 20 polythene tunnels growing produce and machine workshops. Some groups work on community projects in the neighbouring villages.
